reviews.review_msg: Interesting course, prof not good at teaching. Be prepared to learn everything by researching online. Tough works, heavy duties

I was a bit apprehensive with his lecture at first because he doesn't really do demos, only writing them on his iPad. However, he is really accessible if you have any questions. His grading criteria are clear. You also get to have a cheat sheet for all exams. Lastly, I really like that he connects the course content with his industry experience.

He always goes above and beyond basic teaching requirements. His assignments are very meticulously designed to help students learn the material the best way possible. He also makes use of his industry experiences in teaching which is both practical and refreshing.

Dr. Pei gives a clear understanding of what each exam will look like, including topics for each question, so preparing is straightforward. He also did several check-ups on students throughout the term to adjust the difficulty of the class and sent us off with a heart-warming email at the end. Simply one of the best profs in the CMPT department.

Professor Pei is one of the most caring profs I've ever had - he extended the deadline for an assignment and pushed one midterm back a week to make sure we were all good with the material. His lectures can be kind of long, but his assignments are great for applying concepts and his midterms were very fair.

Go look at Pei's website and then be in amazed at his list of accomplishments. Now be happy because not only does he have the expertise, he is also a great prof. Fair assignments, and then more than fair exams that are based off of those assignments. Also great for asking questions and having additional office hours. Do attend class though.
Extended the deadline for Assignment 2 two times. Automatic 5/5. KEKW

Professor Pei is a fair professor for CMPT 354. His lectures and slides are dense with information, and occasionally he would forget to update them prior to class. Lectures do drag on for a while, especially in the 2 hour lectures. However, there are tons of useful content in his slides and his assignments are great for applying in-class topics!

He is willing to scale the difficulty of the course to match student feedback. His tests were scaled to include less theory in exams 2 and 3. His slides often included real life applications and motivates the problem before teaching it, but his tendency to do so may be from the fact that he is the VP of one of the biggest Chinese companies.

Wonderful prof. The tests and homework are designed really well so that they make you work for understanding the concepts. The slides may be on the more difficult/confusing side, and might contain unnecessary entrepreneurial information but otherwise, you get a lot from taking 459. Also, Dr. Pei is a very knowledgeable, passionate and kind person.

Lectures are content heavy and lengthy/wordy. Course itself really wasn't too difficult especially if you have some data science background. If you're completely new then this 400-level class is gonna be harder for you. Very unclear and arbitrary marking practices though. Not always open to correct answers if they differ from his explanation.

Very nice professor but his class is very hard for no reason. I am sure if I took this class with anybody else I would be doing much better. His exams are lengthy and full of proofs, and his lectures are confusing. I don't get the point of teaching data mining using proofs when you can write the algorithm using one line of code. Avoid at all costs.

Even though he is such a nice person, his class is extremely difficult. I had the worst experience in this class. His lectures are just so confusing. It is extremely hard to understand. His explanations on a lot of topics are extremely vague. He makes lengthy exam so that students cannot finish in time (and he says it in his slides).

Dr Pei is overall a pretty good professor. His lectures and explanations were OK. Had to rewatch a couple subjects in order to fully understand what was going on. He listens to feedback and adjusts his course accordingly which was nice and refreshing. Overall, take Dr Pei if you are interested in the subject he is teaching.
His lecture notes are so not organized, I spotted mistakes at many places. His accent is thick and sometimes hard to understand. Lectures were actually interesting.

Jian Pei is a very kind and caring professor. However, it would be nice if this course were more streamlined. In many of his assignments questions were not clarified very well. I don't like the idea of pop quizzes in a 400-level as well. Mainly though, his notes are so bloated that you don't end up learning a lot, just cramming information.

Pop quizzes were a tad annoying for a 4th year course, but Dr. Pei does make it worth your while to attend lectures due to his passion for the field. Pretty easy credit Id say if youre looking for an upper division CMPT. Projects were long but not difficult, and if you achieve 50% total grade then he promises to pass you.

Well, I did not put too much effort at all into that course so did not end up with a good grade. Totally personal reason and I don't blame the prof at all. My classmates seem to enjoy his lectures and he seems to be a reasonable grader.

He is a nice person but as a teacher he is far from great. I am not convinced that he really understands some of the algorithms he teaches; otherwise he would be much more confident answering questions. His assignments are not clearly explained, sometimes even confusing.

Jian is very interested in the area of data mining and it shows. He is very passionate in his lectures and conveys the material well. English is an issue for him, very thick accent and sometimes he is hard to understand. Other than that very good. Would highly recommend for this class.
His notes/lectures are lacking, but assignments and exams are fair
Good teacher, and assignment is very easy.
He teaches the details clearly. Reading the textbook becomes much easier after his classes. Most importantly, the exam questions are consistent with the assignment. Enjoying ...

The classes in the first week were great. He touched some interesting and far from trivial topics immediately. The explanation is so clear that I had an easy time to read the textbook. I am looking forward to  more in the course.

easy class in terms of content. project for 15% is bs since it's just using tablets to show HP that he's actually doing something with them (learning nothing db oriented) and too much work for 15%. overall easy exams and assignment marking resulting in high average of class and 80% being a B-.

Lots of material and workload, but worthwhile learning. Understandable lecs although his English is fluent but problematic. Somewhat challenging asns, but eventually doable. TA is a nice marker. Major pbms are the 15% semesterlong project (tedious data cleaning and programming) and the bell curve which actually lowers grades of many students.
average as an instructor
Nice teacher, really knows what he teahches. 3 assignments in total and one group project. Easy midterm and final.
Nice, competent prof. Lectures not engaging and too connected to slides. Follow the class and put the required time into the project and you'll do fine. Recommended.

He often talks about practical concerns and solutions, which cannot be found in our textbook. The materials are not easy, but quite useful afterall. I got something really helpful in job hunting. I realized that only after my interviews. The final grades were surprisingly nice. I wish I had spent more time on it.
Jian is a good teacher and is very helpful with any of his students' problems.  The exams were fair, but tough.  The project was long, but not too challenging.

will this guy ever understand that developing a project of that size is human impossible for a group of 2 people? The TA helps us a lots "marking" it. Take this class if you like to read the book too.. sometimes he doesn't explain some topics very clearly or he doesn't explain at all...
Very hard project, but thankfully, a fun project and the small assignment load made it easier.  Jian is a very clear prof and an excellent teacher.

Very nice in assigning the final grades. Tough and fair final exam. I did not spend enough time until the last 2 weeks. The email discussion with him was particularly helpful. If I could take it once more, I would spend more time and do much better.

Course overall is okay. His pronounciation is annoying, as are the typos in his notes. Wait until he talks about taking fuzzy dumps. He is genuinely a nice guy, but VERY high expectations  for the project. Partners should be mandatory or else you will probably fail due to lack of time. Assignments and midterm were fair. ie: give examples of...

project is just ridiculously time consuming and tedious. otherwise the course isn't too hard but it's not very interesting.
 decent prof, he knows what he's talking about but his english needs some work.
Touch midterm, but close enough to assignments. Overall challenging and interesting. One of the best in this school.
waste of time
Very good prof, fair and knows how to teach :)

Very interesting project, though sounds challenging. He explained the major ideas clearly, and left the details for you. Clear lectures, easy to follow. Of course, you have to read the textbook after the class. He has accent, but not too bad. Highly recommended by people in his classes before. Very nice guy overall.

Agree with the disappointed comment.  He is a very nice person and very enthusiastic, but very horrible course notes.  His marking on projects are very sloppy just like his project descriptions.  He enjoys torturing students to teach them a taste of real life .. fun :P

Super easy.  Class average is currently around 95%... what this means for final grades we'll see.  Interesting project and decent lectures.  He is clear and seems to understand what to say to convey the material clearly and efficiently.

I read about all the good words here about him before taking this course. However, short after the semestre began I started to doubt if this was the person as described by others. He is a nice softie, but stubborn. Loose requirements on projects led to lousy marking confilicts. Being not so stardardized is the biggest problem.
He is a nice person, but not very clear on the lecture and notes
The bst teaching skills in the whole department.  A super nice guy.
This guy is a genius.  Very keen.
No Comments
He is a very good, helpful, and knowledgeable instructor
